intro: Anneslia alamosensis, commonly known as the Alamosan larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with showy blooms. Anneslia alamosensis is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
